ext_descriptions.ext_description: The effectivity_item type is an extensible list of alternate entity data types. It provides a mechanism to refer to instances of the data types included in the types that extend the effectivity_item type. This empty extensible select type requires extension in a further module, to ensure that any entity data type that refers to it can have a valid instantiation.

An Effectivity_assignment is the association of an
with product or activity data.
the instance of the entity that is assigned.

ext_description.p:
the text that specifies the purpose of the association of the
withitems.

For an
that identifies a period of time, if applicable, the following values shall be used:

ul.li: 'actual': The defines a period of time during which the associated items are or were effective;
'planned': The defines a period of time during which the associated items are or were expected to be effective;
'required': The defines a period of time during which the associated items are or were required to be effective.

ext_descriptions.ext_description:

whose effectivity is characterized by this entity.

An Ineffectivity_assignment is the association of an
with product or activity data to state that the assigned items are not effective.
the instance of the entity that is assigned.

For an
that identifies a period of time, if applicable, the following values shall be used:

ul.li: 'actual': The defines a period of time during which the associated items are or were ineffective;
'planned': The defines a period of time during which the associated items are or were expected to be ineffective;
'required': The defines a period of time during which the associated items are or were required to be ineffective.
